item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, March 25, 2025 at 1:25 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Tesla deliveries down 43% in Europe while EVs are up 31% (91 points | 32 comments)
2. 9.8 Critical Vulnerabilities in Ingress Nginx (40 points | 2 comments)
3. Coding Isn't Programming (76 points | 44 comments)
4. German parliament votes as a Git contribution graph (450 points | 134 comments)
5. X's head of engineering is out (26 points | 9 comments)
6. Quad9 – A public and free DNS service for a better security and privacy (21 points | 1 comment)
7. Samsung CEO Jong-hee Han has died (22 points | discuss)
8. Writing your own C++ standard library from scratch (86 points | 64 comments)
9. Search My Site – open-source search engine for personal and independent websites (152 points | 39 comments)
10. Closing the Chapter on OpenH264 (31 points | 12 comments)
11. Qwen2.5-VL-32B: Smarter and Lighter (487 points | 246 comments)
12. Triforce – a beamformer for Apple Silicon laptops (545 points | 200 comments)
13. Reflecting on WikiTok (80 points | 22 comments)
14. Spammers are better at SPF, DKIM, and DMARC than everyone else (196 points | 92 comments)
15. A study reveals that deciduous trees' roots remain active in winter (21 points | 8 comments)
16. The Lost Towers of the Guelph-Ghibelline Wars (54 points | 22 comments)
17. WWI's 'Dazzle' Camouflage Seemed Effective Due to Unexpected Optical Trick (84 points | 53 comments)
18. Status as a Service (2019) (48 points | 25 comments)
19. The Great Barefoot Running Hysteria of 2010 (99 points | 105 comments)
20. Three Hundred Years Later, a Tool from Isaac Newton Gets an Update (116 points | 32 comments)
21. High‑dose Vitamin D reduces disease activity in early multiple sclerosis onset (48 points | 12 comments)
22. Battling the Blaze: Artifacts from the history of firefighting (8 points | 1 comment)
23. Brain Scans of Infants Reveal the Moment We Start Making Memories (78 points | 37 comments)
24. The Hartlib Papers (6 points | discuss)
25. An AI bubble threatens Silicon Valley, and all of us (4 points | discuss)
26. CO2 laser enables long-range detection of radioactive material (96 points | 19 comments)
27. Gene drive modified mosquitoes offer new tool for malaria elimination efforts (17 points | 16 comments)
28. Tim, don't kill my vibe (4 points | discuss)
29. Why we chose LangGraph to build our coding agent (39 points | 9 comments)
30. I won't connect my dishwasher to your cloud (791 points | 514 comments)
